title: Israeli-American Teen Arrested for Jewish Center Bomb Threats, Report Says
text:
Israeli-American Teen Arrested for Jewish Center Bomb Threats, Report Says By Nicholas Rizzi | March 23, 2017 9:22am Twitter Facebook Email More 
NEW YORK CITY â€” A 19-year-old Israeli-American man of Jewish faith was arrested for a string of bomb threats targeting Jewish community centers around the United States, according to reports. 
The suspect, who has dual Israeli and American citizenships, called in dozens of anonymous threats to various centers across the Unites State since the beginning of the year, according to the Associated Press and Haaretz . The man, who lived in the south of Israel for years, used technology to mask the origin of his calls and also made some to places in New Zealand and Australia, the AP reported. 
The suspect's father was also take into custody, Haaretz reported. 
It's unclear if the suspect is linked to the bomb threats to the centers in New York City, including the ones at the Staten Island JCC. 
The NYPD did not have any information on the arrest. 
There have been about 165 bomb threats called into various Jewish centers across the country since January, according to the Anti-Defamation League , whose Manhattan offices were targeted twice.
